Mental Health

Lorem ipsum dolor sit, amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Ipsam, ut excepturi? Iste possimus! Lorem ipsum dolor sit, amet consectetur adipisicing elit.

Prevention

Recognizing Warning Signs

  • Too much sleep or trouble sleeping
  • Trouble focusing or having racing thoughts
  • Changes in appetite
  • Isolating yourself from others
  • Irritability or having a short temper
  • Feeling excessively sad or low
  • Extreme/Excessive mood changes
  • Losing interest in things you once enjoyed

    • Maintaining Mental Health

  • Practicing Mindfulness
  • Connecting with others
  • Having a positive outlook on stress
  • Having a healthy diet and regular exercise
  • Avoiding drug use
  • Getting 8-10 hours of sleep per night
  • Using time management to reduce stress
  • Seeking Professionial Help if needed

    • Risk Factors

    Statistics

    20% of children and adolescents with diagnosable mental health problems recieve the treatment they need

    20% of adolescents

    with mental health problems recieve the treatment they need

    50% of cases

    of mental health issues begin by age 14

    2/3of students

    with anxiety or depression don't seek treatment
